solution_line_template: A jar of almond butter costs {almond_butter_cost_factor} * {pb_jar_cost} = $<<{almond_butter_cost_factor}*{pb_jar_cost}={almond_butter_jar_cost}>>{almond_butter_jar_cost}.

It takes half a jar to make a batch of cookies, so it costs {almond_butter_jar_cost} / {jar_fraction_for_batch_divisor} = $<<{almond_butter_jar_cost}/{jar_fraction_for_batch_divisor}={almond_butter_batch_cost}>>{almond_butter_batch_cost} to use almond butter.
It costs {pb_jar_cost} / {jar_fraction_for_batch_divisor} = $<<{pb_jar_cost}/{jar_fraction_for_batch_divisor}={pb_batch_cost}>>{pb_batch_cost} to use peanut butter.

Thus, it costs {almond_butter_batch_cost} - {pb_batch_cost} = $<<{almond_butter_batch_cost}-{pb_batch_cost}={cost_difference}>>{cost_difference} more to make a batch of almond butter cookies than peanut butter cookies.
